blog.name: acepalindrome
blog.title: you're going to be something extraordinary
blog.description: Hello, this is Palindrome! I'm currently doing my best to pretend that I'm a functional and well adjusted adult, with varying levels of success! Around this neck of the woods you'll find history stuff, nature stuff, whatever fandoms I'm into at the moment, fanfics I write when I can muster up the energy, the occasional mental breakdown and a variety of fun facts I come across or things I find interesting. Feel free to follow or drop me a line, I promise I'm quite tame.

summary: Listen half the reason I love Caduceus so much is he’s got all my feelings about good and evil wrapped up in a fuzzy pink...
body: Listen half the reason I love Caduceus so much is he’s got all my feelings about good and evil wrapped up in a fuzzy pink package. It’s all about your actions. Nobody’s innately good or evil. Good and evil live in your choices, that’s all.

reblog.comment: Listen half the reason I love Caduceus so much is he’s got all my feelings about good and evil wrapped up in a fuzzy pink package. It’s all about your actions. Nobody’s innately good or evil. Good and evil live in your choices, that’s all.

blog.name: idonottlikethishellsite

blog.description: waiting for fandom to move somewhere else so we can all have naked people again. in the meantime i need a place to reblog DnD stuff.

tags: I feel like a master post would be an hours long compilation at this point
summary: Lots of fun throwaway lines to choose from now, huh?
title: Lots of fun throwaway lines to choose from now, huh?
body:
“Make a persuasion check.”

“The most important thing is that she loves and cares for you and wants to support you from afar.”

“Your son has been captured?”

summary: Loved the first episode of PubDraw on Geek and Sundry! I’m sort of new to drawing and I definitely reccomend it to anyone that...
body: Loved the first episode of PubDraw on Geek and Sundry! I’m sort of new to drawing and I definitely reccomend it to anyone that is even somewhat interested in sketching. I drew with them and then proceeded to draw my own three D&D characters and Lup from The Adventure Zone! Critical Role cast is on my to-do list:)

tags: actually any member of the m9 would be cute with glasses
summary:
I know Laura's never mentioned it but Jester would look cute with glasses. 
I mean, she spent her whole childhood inside! She...
body:
I know Laura’s never mentioned it but Jester would look cute with glasses.

I mean, she spent her whole childhood inside! She read a lot! She writes and draws a lot! I want to see her open her journal, put on some big wire-rim spectacles and say, with a flourish of her pen, “dear Traveler, today, I drew a mustache on a statue of the Platinum Dragon….”

reblog.comment:
I know Laura’s never mentioned it but Jester would look cute with glasses.

tags: i just don't think matt would go against his players like that
as a theatre person who's done some kickass improv in my time
this is like the biggest mistake you can make
and d&d is like 70% improv roleplay and 30% dice rolls
give or take a bit depending on the session
so you really have to follow those rules for respectful improv
or risk the game turning into an absolute shitshow
please don't hate on me for saying this
i just think it had to be said at some point
summary: I’ve seen a bunch of people theorizing that Trent Ikithon altered Caleb’s memories so he’d believe that he killed his parents,...
body:
I’ve seen a bunch of people theorizing that Trent Ikithon altered Caleb’s memories so he’d believe that he killed his parents, even though he didn’t. I think it’s entirely possible within the world Matt has built, but I’m almost entirely positive it’ll never be canon for one big reason: Matt would never do that to Liam. 

First off, it breaks the characterization of Caleb that Liam has put so much hard work into. It would be different if Caleb didn’t have so much trauma caught up in the violent deaths of his parents, and it would be different if his one big objective wasn’t to bend reality and make it so that his parents never died. But these are two vital parts of Caleb’s character, and revealing that he never killed his parents, and that Trent just made him think he did? That breaks the character. He no longer has any long-term goals (except for possibly defeating Trent, but Caleb has made it very clear that he is entirely too fearful of Trent’s immense magical prowess to even dream of attempting that for a VERY long time). If this happened, it might trigger some kind of existential crisis, and reverse all of the progress he’s made in terms of trusting the people he’s with, and trusting himself. 

But most importantly, it breaks the first big rule of all improv: “Yes, and…” If Caleb’s murder of his parents wasn’t so vital to his character, again, this would be different. But your job as a roleplayer of any kind is to take what your scene partners have put on the metaphorical table AS IS, and add something of your own. If you’re in an improv scene, and your scene partner calls you “Jerry,” you can’t just say, “I’m not Jerry, I’m Paul!” You roll with it. Now, a DM’s job is to take a bunch of characters and add a plot, but they still have to follow that rule. You can alter circumstances and intentions; you can flesh out the bits in your players’ backstories that are left (usually intentionally) a little vague; but you should NEVER change the actual events that your player has set in front of you. 

I’m not gonna tell you that it’s a hard and fast rule that can’t be broken, or else you’re a terrible DM and I hate you. But the rule of “Yes, and…” is one of respect. You respect what the other players are bringing to the table by letting it happen as they say it happens, and they return the favor by respecting what you say and do (dice rolls excluded, of course). If Matt were to reveal that Trent had changed Caleb’s memories, and that Caleb never really murdered his parents, it would certainly have consequences for the character, as detailed in the second paragraph of this post. But it would also show little respect for the backstory so carefully crafted by Liam. It would be like saying, “I’m the one telling this story, not you.” 

And that’s my biggest issue with this theory; it implies that Matt has little to no respect for his players, which is anything but the truth. I don’t think anyone who’s talked about this theory had malicious intent in voicing their opinions, and I don’t want to come across as combative or rude. I’m just calling attention to an important aspect of roleplaying in D&D that I haven’t seen anyone mention as of yet in discussing that theory.

blog.name: genderliquid
blog.title: Genderliquid
blog.description: Ali, 24, from London living in Edinburgh, evolutionary biology is my jam. They or Spivak pronouns. I just really love critical role and my bravest goblin-like creature Nott.

summary: Episode 49 was great but I really wanted to know what that nights sleep was like: Did Nott and Caleb share a room with her...
body: Episode 49 was great but I really wanted to know what that nights sleep was like: Did Nott and Caleb share a room with her curled at the foot of the bed? Did they hug?? Was there a distance between them that wasn’t there before? Did they get closer? I need to know.

reblog.comment: Episode 49 was great but I really wanted to know what that nights sleep was like: Did Nott and Caleb share a room with her curled at the foot of the bed? Did they hug?? Was there a distance between them that wasn’t there before? Did they get closer? I need to know.

trail.content_raw: Episode 49 was great but I really wanted to know what that nights sleep was like: Did Nott and Caleb share a room with her curled at the foot of the bed? Did they hug?? Was there a distance between them that wasn’t there before? Did they get closer? I need to know.
trail.content: Episode 49 was great but I really wanted to know what that nights sleep was like: Did Nott and Caleb share a room with her curled at the foot of the bed? Did they hug?? Was there a distance between them that wasn’t there before? Did they get closer? I need to know.

blog.name: thegriffin-blakefamily
blog.title: And Now You're Home
blog.description: Erin. I would defend Clarke Griffin with my life. Probably 59% The 100, 40% Critical Role, and 1% random nonsense. Not spoiler-free. Bellarke and Fjorester trash. I play video games, read a lot of books, and write. (Other fandoms may include, but are not limited to: Star Wars, GOT, Anne with an E, Crazy Ex-Girlfriend, Stranger Things, Veronica Mars, B99, Superstore)

summary: So a bunch of my friends listen to TAZ and I decided I should get on that cuz I listened to like 20 episodes of Balance awhile...
body: So a bunch of my friends listen to TAZ and I decided I should get on that cuz I listened to like 20 episodes of Balance awhile ago. I’m gonna start with Amnesty cuz I’m currently playing MotW and it’s great. I looked it up, there’s 21 episodes… Each episode is about an hour long… That’s makes for a total of like 5 Critical role episodes… This isn’t gonna be as hard as I thought.

blog.name: acepalindrome
blog.title: you're going to be something extraordinary
blog.description: Hello, this is Palindrome! I'm currently doing my best to pretend that I'm a functional and well adjusted adult, with varying levels of success! Around this neck of the woods you'll find history stuff, nature stuff, whatever fandoms I'm into at the moment, fanfics I write when I can muster up the energy, the occasional mental breakdown and a variety of fun facts I come across or things I find interesting. Feel free to follow or drop me a line, I promise I'm quite tame.

summary: Matt did do something in the campaign guide for that. Specifically the Strife emperor who is a betrayer god. He took a people...
question: Matt did do something in the campaign guide for that. Specifically the Strife emperor who is a betrayer god. He took a people called the Drennasar and tortured them, twisting them into goblins, hobgoblins and bugbears to fulfill his own purposes. It's called the Curse of Strife! Theres still some Drennasar left, in Xhorhas, who managed to avoid it and are trying to find a way to uncurse their kin. Hasn't seemed to have helped much yet.
answer: Eeeehhh….not a big fan of that. That’s still playing into the ‘naturally evil’ trope. Like there’s some wiggle room to make things better but it’s still saying they’re just born evil. It’s Tolkien orcs 2.0.

reblog.comment: Eeeehhh….not a big fan of that. That’s still playing into the ‘naturally evil’ trope. Like there’s some wiggle room to make things better but it’s still saying they’re just born evil. It’s Tolkien orcs 2.0.

trail.content_raw: Eeeehhh….not a big fan of that. That’s still playing into the ‘naturally evil’ trope. Like there’s some wiggle room to make things better but it’s still saying they’re just born evil. It’s Tolkien orcs 2.0.
trail.content: Eeeehhh….not a big fan of that. That’s still playing into the ‘naturally evil’ trope. Like there’s some wiggle room to make things better but it’s still saying they’re just born evil. It’s Tolkien orcs 2.0.

summary: sam on talks machina a million years ago about how Nott would have reacted if the tax collectors had picked up Kiri and the...
body:
sam on talks machina a million years ago about how Nott would have reacted if the tax collectors had picked up Kiri and the Shusters while the Nein were fighting in prison: that would have been horrible! You don’t want to separate KIDS from their PARENTS, guys, that would be CRAZY!

thanks ever so much samuel riegel

summary: I honestly feel that Nott’s words to Caleb about him not being to blame for his parents deaths, and that his pain is a mask that...
body: I honestly feel that Nott’s words to Caleb about him not being to blame for his parents deaths, and that his pain is a mask that he can take off when he is ready, carry even more weight now that it’s been revealed she’s a parent herself? And I really hope Caleb will come to feel that as well.

reblog.comment: I honestly feel that Nott’s words to Caleb about him not being to blame for his parents deaths, and that his pain is a mask that he can take off when he is ready, carry even more weight now that it’s been revealed she’s a parent herself? And I really hope Caleb will come to feel that as well.

And I really hope Caleb will come to feel that as well.
trail.content: I honestly feel that Nott’s words to Caleb about him not being to blame for his parents deaths, and that his pain is a mask that he can take off when he is ready, carry even more weight now that it’s been revealed she’s a parent herself? And I really hope Caleb will come to feel that as well.

tags: im prob the only one who just realized but damn
summary: Uhhh on episode 12, when the mage tower fell and they watched a few mages scurry from the tower. Just realized one of those...
body:
Uhhh on episode 12, when the mage tower fell and they watched a few mages scurry from the tower. Just realized one of those people was probably Trent.

(Around 3:57:08) One of the mages he was described was an old human male with grey hair decorated in ceremonial orange armor, and when Matt went on about him Liam, as Caleb, started to turn away. The exact thing he did was this

I’m sure someone has surely pointed this out and others already know but damn did this fly over my head
